description:
Business Development Manager - Cell Therapy/Oncology

Location: San Francisco, California

Our client, a leading player in the dynamic field of Cell Therapy/Oncology, is seeking a results-driven and experienced Business Development Manager to join their growing team. As a pioneer in the life sciences industry, our client is committed to advancing innovative solutions that make a meaningful impact in the field of oncology.

Key Responsibilities:
• Develop and implement strategic business development plans to expand the company's presence in the Cell Therapy/Oncology space.
• Identify and build strong relationships with key stakeholders, including biopharmaceutical companies, research institutions, and other relevant organizations.
• Utilize a comprehensive understanding of the Cell Therapy/Oncology landscape to identify and capitalize on business opportunities.
• Lead sales efforts, negotiate contracts, and drive revenue growth in alignment with organizational goals.
• Leverage existing industry networks and cultivate new connections to enhance the company's reach and influence.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of business development initiatives.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in Medical Sciences, Biology, or a related field. Advanced degree (MSc, PhD) is a plus.
• Minimum of 5 years of proven experience in business development within the Cell Therapy/Oncology space.
• Strong understanding of the regulatory landscape, market trends, and competitive dynamics in the oncology sector.
• Demonstrated success in building and maintaining strategic partnerships with key industry players.
• Exceptional communication and negotiation skills with the ability to articulate complex scientific concepts to diverse audiences.
• Proven track record of driving sales and achieving revenue targets.
• A self-motivated individual with a proactive approach to identifying and pursuing business opportunities.

Please only apply if you have worked in the Cell or gene therapy space/oncology.
